intro: Euphrasia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating eye conditions and respiratory ailments. Its delicate appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
